events.originalText: A group of knife-wielding terrorists attacked passengers at Kunming railway station in Kunming, China, leaving 31 victims dead and more than 140 others injured.
events.subtitle: 2014 Kunming attack
events.headline: Terrorist attack at Kunming railway station leaves 31 dead

events.originalText: The Armenian military and national police attacked a crowd of people protesting the results of the recent election in Yerevan, leading to 10 deaths and over 100 arrests.
events.subtitle: 2008 Armenian presidential election protests
events.headline: Armenian military clashes with protesters in Yerevan, 10 dead

events.originalText: The Pink Floyd album The Dark Side of the Moon was released.
events.subtitle: Pink Floyd
events.headline: Pink Floyd releases The Dark Side of the Moon album

events.originalText: Archbishop of Chicago Samuel Stritch was appointed Pro-Prefect of the Propagation of Faith, becoming the first American member of the Roman Curia.
events.subtitle: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Chicago
events.headline: Archbishop Samuel Stritch appointed Pro-Prefect of Propagation of Faith

events.originalText: In a trial lasting less than 90 minutes, German–British physicist Klaus Fuchs was convicted of violating the Official Secrets Act by supplying information from the Manhattan Project to the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Klaus Fuchs
events.headline: Physicist Klaus Fuchs convicted of violating Official Secrets Act

events.originalText: World War II: American and Australian troops won the Battle of Sio against Japanese forces in New Guinea.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: American and Australian troops win Battle of Sio in New Guinea

events.originalText: Hoover Dam, straddling the Arizona–Nevada border on the Colorado River, was completed.
events.subtitle: Hoover Dam
events.headline: Hoover Dam completed on Arizona-Nevada border

events.originalText: The Australian cricket team, led by Warwick Armstrong, became the first team to complete a whitewash in the Ashes, an achievement that would not be repeated for 86 years.
events.subtitle: Australia national cricket team
events.headline: Australian cricket team achieves whitewash in the Ashes

events.originalText: The Kronstadt rebellion began following mass protests in Petrograd demanding greater freedom in Russia with sailors and citizens taking up arms against the Bolsheviks.
events.subtitle: Kronstadt rebellion
events.headline: Kronstadt rebellion begins in Russia against Bolsheviks

events.originalText: Ethiopia defeated Italy at the Battle of Adwa, ending the First Italo-Ethiopian War.
events.subtitle: Battle of Adwa
events.headline: Ethiopia defeats Italy at Battle of Adwa, ending war

events.originalText: French physicist Henri Becquerel discovered the principle of radioactive decay when he exposed photographic plates to uranium salts.
events.subtitle: Henri Becquerel
events.headline: Henri Becquerel discovers principle of radioactive decay

events.originalText: Yellowstone National Park (bison pictured), located mostly in the present-day U.S. state of Wyoming, was established by President Ulysses S. Grant.
events.subtitle: Yellowstone National Park
events.headline: Yellowstone National Park established by President Ulysses S. Grant

events.originalText: Paraguayan War: Marshal Francisco Solano López died at the Battle of Cerro Corá.
events.subtitle: Paraguayan War
events.headline: Marshal Francisco Solano López dies at Battle of Cerro Corá

events.originalText: The Russian chemist Dmitri Mendeleev finished his design of the first periodic table.
events.subtitle: Dmitri Mendeleev
events.headline: Dmitri Mendeleev finishes design of first periodic table

events.originalText: Muhammad Ali Pasha, governor of Ottoman Egypt, killed the Mamluk leaders of Cairo and seized power.
events.subtitle: Muhammad Ali of Egypt
events.headline: Muhammad Ali Pasha seizes power in Ottoman Egypt

events.originalText: Samuel Chase, the only Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States to be impeached, was acquitted by the Senate.
events.subtitle: Samuel Chase
events.headline: Justice Samuel Chase acquitted by Senate after impeachment

events.originalText: An attempt by Francis, Duke of Guise, to disperse a church service by Huguenots in Wassy, France, turned into a massacre, resulting in 50 dead, and starting the French Wars of Religion.
events.subtitle: Francis, Duke of Guise
events.headline: Massacre in Wassy, France sparks French Wars of Religion
